general_query_triggers.root_operation: If the primary intent or objective of the procedure is unclear, leading to ambiguity between root operations (e.g., is it truly Replacement or just Repair without replacement? Is it Occlusion or Restriction?)
general_query_triggers.approach: If the access method (e.g., open, percutaneous, percutaneous endoscopic) is not explicitly stated or clearly implied by the documented steps
general_query_triggers.device: If the specific type of device used (e.g., synthetic graft type, specific stent, hybrid device, allograft, autograft) is not named or sufficiently described to assign the correct device character

root_operation.supporting_documentation: Look for phrases indicating transection of the ascending aorta/aortic arch and its replacement with a graft, and reattachment of arch vessels

approach.supporting_documentation: Look for phrases indicating median sternotomy, direct visualization, and extensive dissection

device.supporting_documentation: Look for explicit mention of the graft material used for replacement

supporting_operative_details: Median sternotomy or other open access to the aortic arch
Use of cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) and circulatory arrest
Transection or resection of the aortic arch (and/or ascending aorta)
Placement of a graft (e.g., Dacron tube graft) to replace the resected segment
Reattachment of the arch vessels (e.g., innominate, common carotid arteries) to the new graft (e.g., as an island)
query_triggers: If total aortic arch replacement objectives (replacement, reattachment) are not explicitly confirmed
If cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) and circulatory arrest are not clearly documented
If graft material, size, or specific anastomosis technique is not noted

objective_determination.description: What is the objective of the embolization procedure for aneurysm repair?

scenario_documentation: Tumor embolization to cut off blood supply
example_codes: Occlusion of vessel (e.g., for tumor embolization)

options.objective: narrow the lumen of a vessel (at the site of the aneurysm where it is abnormally wide)
scenario_documentation: Embolization of a cerebral aneurysm, where the objective is not to close off the vessel entirely, but to narrow the lumen
example_codes: Restriction of vessel (e.g., for cerebral aneurysm embolization)

objective_determination.reference: ICD-10-PCS Guideline B3.12: 'If the objective of an embolization procedure is to completely close a vessel, the root operation Occlusion is coded. If the objective of an embolization procedure is to narrow the lumen of a vessel, the root operation Restriction is coded. Examples: Tumor embolization is coded to the root operation Occlusion, because the objective of the procedure is to cut off the blood supply to the vessel. Embolization of a cerebral aneurysm is coded to the root operation Restriction, because the objective of the procedure is not to close off the vessel entirely, but to narrow the lumen of the vessel at the site of the aneurysm where it is abnormally wide.'

approach.supporting_documentation: Based on documentation of microcatheter deployment

body_part_identification.question: When embolizing a dissecting aneurysm in the intracranial segment (V4) of the vertebral artery, which body part is most appropriate?
body_part_identification.rationale: 'Intracranial artery' more accurately captures the intracranial nature of the surgery for the V4 segment of the vertebral artery, as per the ICD-10-PCS body part key

supporting_operative_details: Microcatheter deployed into the vertebral artery
Pipeline shield devices (or other flow diverter) deployed
Follow-up angiogram showed adequate coverage and increased stasis within the lumen of the dissecting aneurysm
query_triggers: If Objective (narrow lumen vs. complete closure) not clearly documented
If Specific device type (e.g., flow diverter) not clearly named
If Post-procedure imaging confirming intended outcome (stasis/coverage) absent or unclear

root_operations.condition: Based on documentation of the hybrid device replacing the ascending aorta/aortic arch
supporting_details: Open aortic arch access obtained (implied by procedure description)
Thoraflex™ Hybrid Device deployed through the open aortic arch

root_operations.condition: Based on documentation of the hybrid device stabilizing/repairing (restricting) the descending thoracic aorta
supporting_details: Documentation confirms the device's dual purpose: replacement of ascending aorta/aortic arch AND stabilization/repair of descending thoracic aorta in a single procedure
Device includes a distal stent (as part of the hybrid device)

approach.supporting_documentation: Based on documentation of open aortic arch access

device.primary: Branched Synthetic Substitute with Intraluminal Device
